question_text:
What is the sum of the angle measures in this shape?
___°
backend_description: The image shows a pentagon outlined on a white background. The shape has 5 sides of varying lengths, and none of the angles or side lengths are labeled.
solution: Find out how many triangles make up a pentagon.

A pentagon is made up of 3 triangles, which each have 180°. Multiply.
3 $\times$ 180° = 540°
The angle measures of a pentagon add up to 540°.
solution_image_tag: The image shows a pentagon with 3 diagonals drawn from one vertex. The diagonals divide the pentagon into 3 non-overlapping triangles.

___°
backend_description: The image shows a triangle outlined on a white background. The shape has 3 sides of varying lengths, and none of the angles or side lengths are labeled.
solution: Find out how many triangles make up a triangle.

A triangle is made up of 1 triangle, which has 180°. Multiply.
1 $\times$ 180° = 180°
The angle measures of a triangle add up to 180°.
solution_image_tag: The image shows a triangle. Since it's already a triangle, no diagonals are needed.

A nonagon is made up of 7 triangles, which each have 180°. Multiply.
7 $\times$ 180° = 1260°
The angle measures of a nonagon add up to 1260°.
solution_image_tag: The image shows a nonagon with 7 diagonals drawn from one vertex. The diagonals divide the nonagon into 7 non-overlapping triangles.

question_text:
What is the sum of the angle measures in this shape?
___°
backend_description: The image shows a pentagon outlined on a white background. The shape has 5 sides of varying lengths, and none of the angles or side lengths are labeled.
solution: Find out how many triangles make up a pentagon.

A pentagon is made up of 3 triangles, which each have 180°. Multiply.
3 $\times$ 180° = 540°
The angle measures of a pentagon add up to 540°.
solution_image_tag: The image shows a pentagon with 3 diagonals drawn from one vertex. The diagonals divide the pentagon into 3 non-overlapping triangles.
